results.title: The Last horizon
results.creator_credit: Anthony Buckley, Robert Raymond and Quantum Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Man on the rim series”.
Part 4: “The Feathered Serpent” - The Olmec, Toltec, Maya and Aztec cultures represent the highest achievement of American Indian society. This episode shows how these complex communities and their skills in architecture, sculpture and the arts. “The Last Horizon” The final episode in the greatest migratory movement in the history of the human race belongs to the Polynesians. Their epic voyages from Fiji and Tonga carried them to Hawaii, Tahiti, New Zealand and Easter Island. New sails appeared on the horizon from Europe breaking the isolation of the Pacific. Now, there is a new dawning of the Pacific Century.

results.title: The Last governor
results.brief_description: This series profile the years 1992-1997 when Chris Patten, the last governor of Hong Kong worked to negotiate the handing over of the sovereignty of Hong Kong from Britain to China. Written and presented by Jonathan Dimbleby.

results.title: The Last Goon show of all
results.brief_description: For those people who loved listening to The Goons on the radio, this video is definitely for you. For the BBC’s 50th anniversary in 1972,the archives delivered three coffins before a destinguished audience at the Camden Theatre, London. They contained three men of entertainment history. Spike Milligna, the well-known typing error, script-writer and voice of Eccles, Moriarty, Little Jim and Minnie Peter Sellers, alias Major Bloodnok, Bluebottle, and Henry Crun, practising his comeback by whistling a soliloquy from Hamlet. Harry Secombe, bald, toothless, Welsh and weighing 37 stone, the brains and the brawn behind Neddy Seagoon, dressed in a floral cretonne frock. The Goons take their final bow, in their last performance after 12 years of silence. From 1952-1960, The Goon Show spawned a cult of quickfire humour as radios’ most influential clowns, driven by an inspired lunacy which wrenched conventional comedy into a new era. Preserved on video as a lasting tribute to their genius, the combined manic brilliance of Milligan, Sellers and Secombe is as fresh and funny today as it was yesterday.

results.title: The Last game
results.brief_description: An interactive CD-ROM following a ‘pick-a-path’ approach to a soccer player’s last match. A range of outcomes are generated in reaction to key elememts of a typical football game - penalty kick, injury, extra time. The CD-ROM attempts to describe the possible emotions of the player as he experiences the last game of his career.

results.title: The Last flight of Noah's Ark
results.creator_credit: Ron Miller, Walt Disney Productions and Charles Jarrott
results.brief_description: When a vintage B-29 bomber strays from its course over the Pacific, its crew - a high-living pilot, a prim missionary and two stowaway orphans - is forced to beach it on an unmapped tropical island. Stranded, they plot their way back to civilization. Stars Elliott Gould, Genevieve Bujold, Ricky Schroder, and Vincent Gardenia.

results.title: The Last film search
results.creator_credit: Rex Clayton and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: The ‘Last Film Search’ was launched officially in Melbourne in October 1981 by The National Film and Sound Archive. Its main purpose was to recover early Australian films produced on nitrate stock, so that they can be copied before the nitrate decomposes and the film stock was lost forever. Michael Cordell provides details of the search and some of his finds to date. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Last Emperor
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Thomas, Columbia Pictures and Bernardo Bertolucci
results.brief_description: In 1908 three year old Pu Yi becomes Emperor of Imperial China. In the course of his life-time he will be treated as a God, become a playboy and traitor, and finally end up jailed by the communists. The end of his life is spent happily as a humble gardener. Bertolucci’s film is an astonishing visual treat, encompassing both the history of China in the twentieth century, and elegantly detailing the story of the country’s last imperial ruler. Stars John Lone, Peter O’Toole and Joan Chen. Winner of nine Academy Awards (including Best Picture). The music is by David Byrne and Ryuichi Sakamoto.

results.title: The Last dream: a special report by John Pilger
results.creator_credit: Alan Lowery, ABC-TV (Australia) and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description: A three part series in which John Pilger explores aspects of Australia’s history from first settlement, through its involvement in wars right through to today’s society, and looks at the plight of the Aborigines throughout Australian history.

results.title: The Last detail
results.creator_credit: Gerald Ayres, Columbia Pictures and Hal Ashby
results.brief_description: Jack Nicholson stars in another outstanding performance as a hard-bitten professional Navy-man given the loathsome job of escortinga very young sailor to a military prison for a minor crime. Randy Quaid, as the young man, hasn’t begun to live yet, so Nicholson decides to give him a lifetime of experiences in three days!. This results in a drinking, fighting, womanising binge, unparalleled in movie history.
